document.docAuthor: Costa-Silva, Vinícius, Strümpher, Werner P. & Vaz-de-Mello, Fernando Z.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Brazilian species of Omorgus Erichson, 1847 (Coleoptera: Trogidae: Omorginae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Brazilian species of Omorgus Erichson, 1847 (Coleoptera: Trogidae: Omorginae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype , by monotypy: (
♂
, MNHN, through photographs, Figure 1 a-c). First label [blue]: ‘Batesi/typ./Harold’ [Harold’s handwriting]. Second label [white label]: ‘Amaz.’ [Bates’ handwriting]. Third label [white with black border, typeset]: ‘Ex-Musaeo/H.W. Bates/1892’ [vertically]. Fourth label [white, typeset]: ‘Muséum Paris/ex Coll./R. Oberthür/1952’. Fifth label [red, typeset]: ‘TYPE’. Sixth label [red, with a black border, typeset]: ‘HOLOTYPE’. Seventh label [white, typeset]: ‘ HOLOTYPE / Omorgus /
batesi ( Harold 1872 )
’. Eighth label [white, typeset]: ‘MNHN/EC9646’. Type locality:
BRAZIL
: Amazonia (cited by Harold as ‘Amazonestrom’).

caption.paragraph:
Figure 1. Holotype of
Trox batesi Harold, 1872
(now
Omorgus batesi
). A, dorsal view; B, lateral view, C, holotype labels (Photos by A. Mantilleri, copyright MNHN).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Note . The lectotype designated by Scholtz (1990, p. 1418) from RBINS for
Trox batesi
does not belong to the original type series of this species (see Hielkema and Hielkema 2019 ).

Omorgus batesi
is the only representative of the subgenus. It is very distinctive and can be easily recognised by the smooth and shiny pronotum and elytra without tubercles or ridges. The elytral intercostae is marked with deep round punctures. For a more detailed treatment of the species, see Vaurie (1962) and Scholtz (1990).

This species is widely distributed, yet rarely collected. It has been known so far from Argentina , Paraguay and Brazil , to which we add the first record for Bolivia . From Brazil , it has been recorded across the Amazon (AM, PA, RR), Cerrado (TO, MA), Pantanal (MT, MS) and Atlantic Forest (SP, RJ, ES) biomes ( Figure 8 ).
